summary: The Prison Staffing Reform Act of 2025 mandates the Director of the Bureau of Prisons to conduct a comprehensive review of understaffing within the Bureau. This includes an external review of staffing levels, impact on employees and inmates, and agency spending. The Director must submit a plan for recruitment, vacancy filling, and staffing guidelines to relevant committees and the Council of Prison Locals C–33. The review will address the effects of understaffing on various aspects of prison operations and include a 3-year strategic plan. Annual progress reports on the implementation of the plan are required.
